utterance.speaker: PROTESTOR
utterance.content: Beau Randolph! You’re a creep! You’re a loser! You’re scum! Your whole life adds up to nothing!

utterance.speaker: TROY STRICKLAND
utterance.content: Let me to introduce you to the guy and reason we’re all here tonight. Please give it up for my friend and the founder of College Girls Gone Crazy, Beau Randolph!

utterance.speaker: BEAU RANDOLPH
utterance.content: Thank you Trot. And welcome all of you to what I know will be a night to remember. So enjoy the music, the free drinks, and thank you for being a part of College Girls Gone Crazy: Girls Take Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: All right! Let’s get crazy!

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Another drink Mr. Randolph?

utterance.speaker: BEAU
utterance.content: I’m not here to party. Not tonight.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Maybe next time then.

utterance.speaker: BEAU
utterance.content: I don’t think there’s going to be a next time.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no! No!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Richard, you just ruined my final savasana. If you are method writing and playing the role of your murder victim could you please die a little bit more quietly? Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No Mother, I didn’t – I just – I was – I was googling … myself and I found this.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh! I didn’t know Alexis had a website.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Neither did I. It’s a vlog. It’s a video blog.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, well. That’s charming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No! No, it is not charming.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: So tonight Max and I went ice skating at Rockefeller Center. Again. And yes, I pretended to be unsteady on my skates. Again. And yes. Max caught me as I “fell”. Again.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That is completely adorable. And the camera just loves her. Of course, she gets that from me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, Alexis is sharing – with the whole world, mind you – personal, intimate details about her life. Where she goes, who she goes with. This is not safe.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, when did you get to be such a fuddy-duddy? Believe me, you were far worse in your day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My day is not today. That day is not today. Today is the day of the internet stalker. Today is the day for –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, why don’t you just answer your phone? Oh, and it’s Beckett. Maybe she has a nice murder to distract you from your parental paranoia.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Namaste.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: So she video blogs, Castle, so what? Plenty of people do her age. Why? Did she post something inappropriate?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But that’s not the point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well what is the point?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The point is she’s oversharing. She doesn’t realize whatever she posts on the internet is out there forever.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At least be happy that Alexis isn’t posting something like that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: College Girls Gone Crazy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, brought to you by the master of oversharing, Mr. Beau Randolph.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s all right to look, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at what? So it seems as though Beau Randolph’s world hasn’t changed much since we interviewed him for that frozen head case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except that he’s no longer in it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beau Randolph is our victim?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was murdered in the women’s bathroom? Gives a new meaning to College Girls Gone Crazy.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Looks that way. His body was found in one of the stalls. Cause of death is strangulation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Manual or ligature?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Ligature. Look at these bruises on his neck. It’s from a clasp. On a bra.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The murder weapon was found lying next to him. I figure that a chick lured him in here for a tryst and then choked him out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Time of death?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well he was talking to the bartender around 11:50 and the body was found in the stall at 11:58PM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, do you think we can get DNA off of the murder weapon?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I already collected samples, but check this out. This is a 36D Sultura.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s high end.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Definitely. One of these could run you $200, $250.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: $250 dollars? For a bra?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh, but it’s okay to spend that on a pair of sneakers, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A pair of sneakers is practical, okay? They support your, um –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eject.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The list of shops that sell that can’t be that long, so see if you can figure out who purchased it.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so it looks like there was a guest list at the club tonight. But if you were a guy with $20 bucks in your pocket when you showed up at the door or a pretty girl, you got in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about witnesses? Anyone see who Beau was with?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet, but uniforms are taking witness statements from people here and down at the precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They were shooting for the website tonight, so even if no one saw Beau, chances are someone caught him on video.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was in charge of taping?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The video’s producer, a guy named Troy Strickland. But the bigger question is how anyone got to Beau in the first place. According to club security he came with a bodyguard tonight.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, that worked out, didn’t it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you and Espo take the bodyguard. Castle and I’ll talk to the producer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, where’s the world’s worst bodyguard?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Told security to have him meet us near the rope line. His name is Jones.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This guy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. You Jones?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT JONES
utterance.content: I’m Jones. Scarlett Jones.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Detectives Ryan and Esposito, NYPD.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You were supposed to have eyes on Beau. So what happened?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Beau told me to wait outside with the car. When your boss gives you a directive, you follow it. But it was weird. Like he didn’t want me in there tonight.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you never saw him again after he went into the club?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: I’m afraid not.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you see anyone else that seemed suspicious tonight?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Look, I did my threat assessment, okay? The only one was, uh -

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Tiffany. Tiffany Shaw.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, that’s that actress, right? She does soft-core cable type of – – so I’ve heard.

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: That’s also Beau’s ex-girlfriend. He tried to dump her a two months ago, but she wouldn’t take no for an answer. He got a restraining order against her and that still didn’t keep her away.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And she was here? Tonight?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: She tried to get into the club and I stopped her at the rope line. I told her I would call the police if she didn’t walk away, so she did.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Any chance she came back?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Not through me. But I couldn’t cover every door.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve known Tiffany for a long time. She’s a crazy chick and definitely obsessed with Beau, but I didn’t see her in the club tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did you see, if anything?

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Uh, just pretty girls and good clean American fun. Man, this sucks. I’ve been with Beau since the beginning. I was his first cameraman. First producer. We barely knew what we were doing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he have any family?

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: No. His mom left when he was little. He never knew his dad. I think it’s what drove him, you know? This company was the family he never had. People thought he was a sleaze, surrounding himself with all these women, but it’s because he was looking for something he couldn’t find.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Troy, we’re gonna need to see the footage you shot tonight. There might be evidence on it.

utterance.speaker: GARY MOORE
utterance.content: Troy.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Yeah, whatever you – whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Hey man.

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: Hey. I got down here as soon as I heard, buddy.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: It’s just so awful.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. Detective Beckett, Mr. Castle. This is Gary Moore, our COO. I’ll go get that footage for you.

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: Do you – do you have any idea who did this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right now we’re looking into Tiffany Shaw. Is there anyone else you think might have wanted to harm Beau?

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: Well unfortunately he received death threats on a daily basis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From whom?

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: Moral crusaders. Um, angry boyfriends. Angry fathers. Women who had second thoughts about being in our videos.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you keep track of these threats?

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: Yeah, we have a database back at our offices.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll need you to take us there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. How’s the in-breast-igation going.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And that’s why you’re still single.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So I just got off the phone with Tiffany Shaw’s PR rep. Not only does she wear a 36D like our murder weapon, they can’t find her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Neither can I. So far she’s not in any of this footage that we got from Troy. To tell you the truth, what happens in those club bathrooms that bra could have been left by anyone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And we’ve still got over a hundred statements to take. We’re gonna be here all night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well maybe not. Look, check it out. It’s Beau. You see that? He turns his head. Like he sees something. Or someone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And it’s at 11:50. That’s right around the time of the murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look. He walks right by those women. They’re watching him go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait a minute. The girl in pink. She’s here. She saw where Beau went.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s me. I didn’t want to go, but my girlfriends dragged me out. Now I’m stuck in the middle of all this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Better than in the middle. You saw where he went just before he was murdered. You might have been the last person to see him alive.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Miss Mayfield, when he walked by you did you see where he was going or what he was doing?

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: The lights were flashing. It was pretty hard to see. I’m sorry, I’ve never even seen the guy before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is there usually a guard on duty?

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, he leaves at six but we cans still access out database from his workstation here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’d like to focus on all of the threats from the last six months or so. Is this an entry log?

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: Uh, yes. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It says that Beau Randolph swiped his keycard at 12:09AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s impossible. He was already dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our killer stole the card and then gained entry into this building. What were they after?

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: According to this whoever used that keycard went in to Beau’s office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are there security cameras in there?

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: Pulling it up now.

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: He’s going for the safe. Beau just had that installed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does he keep in there?

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: Uh, I don’t know. But when it came to that safe he was pretty paranoid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s an SD card.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon … turn around.

utterance.speaker: GARY
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Beau Randolph’s body guard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well she’s not very good at her job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Good news is that Scarlett Jones is not the world’s worst bodyguard. Bad news is, she’s a murderer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Someone that sexy going to prison? That in itself is a crime.

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Is this really necessary? I told your detectives everything I know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not everything. For instance, you didn’t tell us that you had been working for Mr. Randolph for only a couple of weeks.

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: How is that relevant?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, in your statement, you said that when Beau went into the club you stayed with the limo.

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: That’s right. That’s what I did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then maybe you can explain this. It appears to be you stealing an SD card.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And before you say evil twin just know it’s been done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You broke into his office just after he died using his keycard. How did you happen to get it?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Look, I didn’t kill Beau. And certainly not for his keycard. He left it in the limo. I knew it was my only chance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean, only chance?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: There was this sex tape. This friend of mine made the mistake of sleeping with Beau and he videotaped it. She knew that if it ever got out it would destroy her life so I took this job to make sure that the tape never got out. When Beau told me to stay with the car I knew it was my only shot, so yes, I – I broke into his office, I took the SD card, and I destroyed it. But that’s all I did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who is this friend of yours?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Her name is Mindy Norton. Like I told your detectives, the killer must be Tiffany. She hated Beau for breaking up with her. Look, she – she must have snuck back into the club while I was gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We reviewed the video footage. There’s no evidence that Tiffany was at the club.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In fact, all of the evidence points to you. Beau died after 11:50. That gave you enough time to kill him, take the SD card, and get back to the club.

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: No, I left for Beau’s office at 11:45. The valets saw me drive off. I am telling you, somebody else did this. And if it wasn’t Tiffany, then – – I think I might know who. Last week there was this guy in Midtown. He practically attacked Beau in the street, saying that he would make Beau pay for whatever it was that he did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know who this guy was?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: No, but he got in Beau’s face. And he was yelling at Beau, saying he had double-crossed him. He got physical so I, uh … stepped in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then what?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Broke his nose and a couple of ribs, I think.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, did you hear that? She broke his nose.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So? That’s hot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you have no idea who he is?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: No. But I’d know if I saw him again.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, Scarlett’s friend Mindy confirmed her story about the sex tape. Plus, two of the valets saw her leave the club at 11:45, so it looks like her alibi’s checking out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, you seem unusually happy about this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, I’m just … you know. You know, working the case. Speaking of which, we’re still trying to track down Tiffany Shaw but no luck so far.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Meantime, Scarlett’s working with a sketch artist on Beau’s attacker. When it’s done send it off to hospital emergency rooms. If she did as much damage as she claims then he would have sought medical attention.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I should probably go see how the sketch is coming along.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you do that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, I’ve been working through the threat database from Beau Randolph’s office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did anything pop?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, one guy. Ronald Armstrong. Founder of Voices for Decency.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that the one that’s on TV all the time? The one that’s pushing a conservative agenda on media groups and community businesses?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s him. He’s the one who organized the protest outside the nightclub.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Any reason to believe that he’s violent?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, here is a quote on his website from Armstrong to his followers. “Our work is to rid the nation of the purveyors of filth. If Beau Randolph doesn’t heed our voices he must fall to our wrath.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But does that make him a suspect?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe not him personally, but two weeks ago Armstrong organized another protest outside Beau Randolph’s loft. Windows are broken, Beau is burned in effigy. It got pretty ugly. Those same protesters were outside the nightclub last night.

utterance.speaker: RONALD ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: Mr. Randolph’s death was like his life. Vulgar. Offensive. Look what’s become of our nation. The truth is, the Beau Randolph’s of this world profit by degrading our culture and everyone in it. I don’t apologize for defending moral values.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The question is, how far would you go to defend them? You recently lead a protest against him that turned violent.

utterance.speaker: ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: A few of my brethren became a bit overzealous, that’s all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe your words gave them encouragement.

utterance.speaker: ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: Make no mistake, we are at war. But I simply ask good people to stand up for their principles. And to use any and all legal means to force change.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I will need the names of all of the protesters that were at the club last night.

utterance.speaker: ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: And I respectfully decline your request.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We can get a warrant.

utterance.speaker: ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: I doubt it. But good luck to you. Thanks for the coffee.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So this is the guy that came after Beau?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Yeah. If I knew he was coming back I’d have broken more than just his nose.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey look, um … about last night at the club. I’m sorry. I was – I was way out of line.

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Yeah. So was I. I should have come clean with you guys. About everything. See ya.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: See ya later. Hey, Scarlett! Uh … do you think maybe we could get a drink later? I mean, now that you’re not a suspect anymore.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So, this is what you do all day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right? Whoa. No, it’s work. That’s – that’s a case.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know. I was just messing with you. Uh so, you wanted to see me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. So Alexis, I, um – I found your vlog, and while it is super cute, um –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, Gram told me. You think I’m catnip for predators online.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. It’s just that people have to be – and especially women – need to be leery about how much they put out into the world. I don’t want to see you haunted for years by something you posted on a whim.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, you’re acting like I’m one of these girls who flashes the camera for a free shot of tequila. It’s just a silly vlog.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With personal information. What if the wrong person sees it?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re always pushing me to get out there, experiment, have fun. But you refuse to trust me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, Alexis –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I’m not having this conversation with you. I’ve gotta go. I’ve got class. No, stay. I’m leaving.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything you want to talk about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No. No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Over here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no look. It’s the guy from Scarlett’s sketch. It’s the man who attacked Beau. Look at his nose. That is from Scarlett hitting him. He was at the club last night. Probably to finish the job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And I can tell you his name. Seth Parrino. Just got off the phone with an ER nurse at Bronx General. Parrino was treated and released for a nasal fracture and some bruised ribs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we know about him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, he was no stranger to violence. He was convicted of racketeering three years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know where we can find him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Racketeering and Parrino owns an import business? Got two words for you, Beckett. Vito Corleone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Technically those are names, not words.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beau Randolph double-crossed a member of the mafia. No wonder he got whacked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That is rampant speculation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rampant speculation is my specialty. What if Beau Randolph produced a video featuring the daughter or a mafia boss? And the brassiere became the mafia’s grotte de jour?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can stop talking now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seth Parrino.

utterance.speaker: SETH PARRINO
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing? You can’t be in here!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. We have a few questions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe more than just a few questions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: College Guys Gone Nuts. Really?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. And I own the trademark, so don’t get any ideas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rats.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Look, everybody here is over 18 and I have my permits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re not here about your dancers, Mr. Parrino. Are we?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right. No. We are here about Beau Randolph.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Okay, yeah. Yeah. We had a falling out. I didn’t kill anybody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A falling out about what?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: This. College Guys Gone Nuts. A couple of months ago I approached him about partnering up. You know. Maybe do for women what he did for men. Could you imagine the merchandising possibilities? DVDs, internet, video games. At first he said he was in, then boom, just like that. Changes his mind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t imagine why.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Beau was a visionary. I grant him that. He was a visionary. But for some reason he just – he couldn’t see it, you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I get it. You’re right. I mean, it’s like wind power. Solar energy.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Exactly! The day this happened? I found out he was going to back out on the deal. Said he was gonna – gonna invest in something else. Some kids programming or something like that. Like I couldn’t tell he was just blowing me off. And then he sticks that bodyguard on me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did you go to the club that night?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: I was trying to make a final pitch. You know, give one more chance to – to – to say yes One more chance to go nuts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I take it he said no.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: I never got a chance to ask. I ran into him in the back and he was having a fight with some chick. It looked nasty. I just – I figured it wasn’t the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when was this?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: At like … 11:30 or so?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 11:30? Do you think you could describe this woman?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s uh … short brown hair. Smoking hot body. Oh, and she had a mole right over her lip.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Here she is. Seth Parrino’s mystery women.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, send her photo to party organizers. See if anyone recognizes her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No need. Check out that mole. Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Beau’s ex-girlfriend Tiffany Shaw was there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She must have disguised herself and slipped into the club after Scarlett left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get out a warrant on her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You think we could have Ryan do that? I have plans.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Do these plans have a name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh shut up. You didn’t.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She broke a guy’s nose. You know she’s gotta be freaky.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: C’mon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t ask. You got anything?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, um .. I never thought I’d say this after graduating the sixth grade, but our bra research is in. Six women purchased a Sultura bra identical to the size and model of our murder weapon from the same Upper East Side lingerie shop Carnal Desires. Of the six, one name stood out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tiffany Shaw.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It gets better. Apparently she must have lost hers because she called the shop this morning to see if they had another one in stock. She’s on her way in to get it right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, it seems like such a shame to have her buy a new one when her old one is right here.

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY SHAW
utterance.content: Oh my God, my bra. Thank you so much. Where did you guys find this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wrapped around Beau Randolph’s neck. Strangling him to death.

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: Ew. Wait, you guys don’t think that I had anything to do with this, do you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The murder weapon belongs to you, our victim had a restraining order against you, and you were so determined to get to see him that night that you changed your appearance in order to get past security.

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: It’s not what you think. Look, I just wanted to talk to him. The two of us were soul mates. And then a couple months ago he changes. He got so serious, so secretive. And then out of the blue he just dumps me. For no reason. I just wanted to know why. I deserved to know why.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you went to the club to confront him.

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: And you know what he said? He said that I wasn’t the kind of person that he could be with anymore. Like he’s suck a saint. And then he said if I showed up again he’d have me arrested.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s pretty harsh. That must have made you angry.

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: Damn right it made me angry. I wanted to hurt him so bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you went into the bathroom … … and then you killed him.

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You killed him.

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: Whoa, okay, no. I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You just said you wanted to hurt him so bad.

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: Yeah. So I grabbed the nearest guy and pulled him into the bathroom for revenge sex.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then how did your bra end up wrapped around Beau Randolph’s neck?

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: I must have left it in the bathroom. You ever do it in a nightclub, Detective? Hot, sweaty, quick? Things go missing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can this guy confirm your story?

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: Confirm it? I mean, knowing men he’s probably told the entire east coast already.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’s his name?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t know his name.

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: It was club sex! Look, I know it was stupid. Afterward I felt awful so I left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what time was that?

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: Around 11:45. You can call my driver. And when I walked out of that club, Beau was still alive. Look, I knew Beau better than anyone and something wasn’t right. I could see it in his eyes. At first I thought it was another woman, so I followed him to see who it was. But when I saw what that bodyguard was up to, I knew it was something bigger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was she up to?

utterance.speaker: TIFFANY
utterance.content: Nothing good. A couple weeks ago I followed her. She was crossing Bryant Park and suddenly she reaches into a trash bin and pulls out this. A bag of cash.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the mystery of Scarlett deepens. A dead drop involving a bag of cash and a trash bin, sending us after false leads at every turn? This is classic spy craft. But whose money is it and who is she really working for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Scarlett’s last few jobs were doing high-level consulting for Fortune 500 companies. That’s a far cry from babysitting Beau Randolph.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe she’s still working for one of them. Maybe her job with Beau was just to get close enough to him to accomplish the real mission.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, whatever that was.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so I just spoke with Scarlett’s friend Mindy. After I explained to her what obstruction of justice looks like she admitted that Scarlett paid her a thousand dollars to couch for that story about that SD card. Whatever’s on it, it’s not a sex tap of her and Beau.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, then what the hell is it and why does she want it so bad?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I think I know how we can find out.

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Pretty much everything.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Super strong.

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s – nah, it’s just work. It seems like they can’t operate without me sometimes. You know how it is. So do you want to get another drink, or maybe get a table? Get some dinner?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: How about we continue this conversation at my place?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or … better yet, why don’t we continue this conversation back at my place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s hot. She kicks ass, she’s a corporate spy. Man, she is perfect. Why did she have to be the bad guy?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry we had to cop-block you, bro.

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: You know this is ridiculous. I had nothing to do with Beau Randolph’s death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I also know that you lied to us.

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: I have an alibi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was on the SD card and who do you work for?

utterance.speaker: SCARELTT
utterance.content: I already told you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn’t take that job to get back a sex tape. And your friend Mindy already recanted her story. And I highly doubt that Beau paid you by leaving cash in a trash bin. So why don’t you drop the act and tell me what the hell is going on and what was on that card?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Scarlett –

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: I don’t know!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you actually expect me to believe that you have no idea what was on the thing that you stole?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: All I know is that Beau was obsessed about it. Paranoid. So I figured it’s exactly what my employer was looking for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did they send you to find?

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Dirt. Incriminating evidence they could use Beau.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who? Who’s your employer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Scarlett, I’m going to find out whether you tell me or not and if they were involved in Beau Randolph’s death that makes you an accomplice unless you help.

utterance.speaker: SCARLETT
utterance.content: Little Frog Enterprises. I was hired by Little Frog Enterprises.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Little Frog Enterprises? The children’s media company? That makes no sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beau told Seth Parrino that he was investing in children’s programming so maybe it’s related.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, what? The folks behind the Jiggleways and Happy Polly’s Puppet Playtime are the people pulling the strings behind Beau’s death?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well all we know for sure is that they were trying to dig up some dirt on Beau.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The man’s life was dirty. He hardly had a sexual encounter that he didn’t try to monetize. What are they hoping to find?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what were they planning on doing with it?

utterance.speaker: EVAN PIERCE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Detective. You’ve got the wrong guy. I uh, I work in wholesome family entertainment. Not smut.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet you or someone from your company hired Scarlett Jones to infiltrate Beau Randolph’s company to spy on him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We figured as founder and CEO you might know something about that.

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: Look, you have to understand. I – I build this company for my children, okay? My grandchildren. So parents wouldn’t have to worry about their kids being exposed to sex and violence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what does this have to do with Beau?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: We expanded too quickly. Sharks were circling. Six weeks ago Beau Randolph approached me and uh, he said he could help. He said he had large cash reserves and he was looking to invest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would Beau want to invest in Little Frog?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: He said that uh, he didn’t want College Girls Gone Crazy to be his legacy. He said he wanted to do more. He liked the company.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I take it you weren’t interested?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: What, and let that guy’s sleazy reputation taint everything that I worked so hard to build? No. I knew exactly what he was doing. He was trying to use my company to legitimize himself. He wanted to use it to obtain something he couldn’t earn on his own.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what’s that?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: Respect. After I said no, he took his proposal to the board. They seemed to like his offer. I was just looking for some leverage. I just needed something to make him back off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure about that? ‘cause given everything you’ve already done it would have been easy to slip into that party and just make it go away.

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: I had nothing to do with Beau Randolph’s death. But I might know who did. Scarlett said that he guarded this SD card with his life. Now I know why. I thought I could use it as leverage against Randolph, but uh … well, now it’s pretty clear he was using it to blackmail someone else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s on it?

utterance.speaker: EVAN
utterance.content: It’s not what. It’s who.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s a sex tape. So what? A guy like Beau could have dozens of these.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not the tape, it’s the girl. I need a shot of her face.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We know her. That’s the girl in pink from the nightclub.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. We took her statement that night. She said she didn’t know Beau.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I guess she died. So what’s her name?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Candice Mayfield. 25.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: According to your report she is literally one of the last people to see Beau Randolph alive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so what’s so special about her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: As far as I can see, nothing. She’s a kindergarten teacher. No record. There’s nothing extraordinary about her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Except for maybe who her father is. According to court documents, Candice Mayfield’s real name is Candice Armstrong, Ronald Armstrong’s daughter.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. This Ronald Armstrong? The founder of Voices for Decency Ronald Armstrong?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm. The one who’s trying to bring down Beau’s company. And Armstrong’s daughter changed her name to her mom’s maiden to get away from all the notoriety.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only Beau found out who she really was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Beau lures her into a tawdry encounter, films it, and then uses the video to blackmail her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if she didn’t agree to get her father off of his back Beau was going to show the tape.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Candice knows that if that tape got out it would ruin her life. It would embarrass her whole family. Beau uses the video to push her into a corner. She’s got no choice but to push back. She’s our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What brings you home? Aside from concocting a ridiculously huge dessert. Kudos, by the way.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I hate it when we argue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s just, I’m 18. I don’t have to ask for permission anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I know that. And I want you to experience things the way I did. It’s just things are different now. If this case has taught me anything it’s that when you put something out there anyone can see it, from a future job interviewer to an internet creep.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You don’t think I know that? My generation grew up in a digital fishbowl. And no matter how careful we are stuff will get out there. Friends will tag me in photos – inevitably doing something stupid. Why should that define me? Why can’t I go out there and define myself?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I get it, Alexis. It’s just that I want –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, look. I know. I know you want to keep me safe. But the only way to do that is wrap me in bubble wrap and hide me in a cave.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Believe me, I’ve thought about it. The thing is, Alexis, there are people out there that will do bad things. And the more expose –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, you know me. I’m careful. And smart. But I need to live my life my way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. But that doesn’t mean I’m going to stop worrying. Doesn’t mean I’m going to stop caring. Or reminding you from time to time that you are indeed wrong.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And I wouldn’t want you to.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: I don’t understand. Why did I have to come back here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you didn’t tell us the whole story, Candice. Twelve seconds after Beau left you walked off in the same direction.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: Well I didn’t follow him if that’s what you’re trying to say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where did you go?

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: I don’t remember. Um, back out on the dance floor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Candice, you’re lying. I know about the video. The one with you and Beau.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: Please don’t tell my father.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to do my best not to. I’m going to need you to meet me halfway though. Beau was blackmailing you, wasn’t he? That’s why you were there last night. And that’s why killed him.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: No, you don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think I do. You’re a kindergarten teacher and knew that video would cost you your job and your reputation, not to mention your dad’s reputation and you lost control. Any jury’s going to sympathize with you and I can put in a good word with the DA. I just need you to tell me exactly what happened.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: Um, I – I’d like to speak with my attorney.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Judge granted us the warrant. The boys are on their way to Candice’s to see if they can find proof that Beau was blackmailing her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s hard isn’t it, when the killer turns out to be a better person than the victim.

utterance.speaker: RONALD ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: Where’s my daughter? My attorney says you’re holding her.

utterance.speaker: ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: I want to talk to my daughter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Armstrong, you should know that Candice is a person of interest in the Beau Randolph case.

utterance.speaker: ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: What? Don’t be ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We should talk about this privately. Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: This is all some kind of hideous mistake. Candice wouldn’t hurt anyone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you aware of any … … connection between her and Beau?

utterance.speaker: ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: A connection with Beau Randolph? Are you joking? And by the way, my Candice would never be caught dead in that club.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, it was Beau that was caught dead. And Candice was in that club.

utterance.speaker: ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: What on Earth was she doing in this place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe she was trying to protect herself from Beau. Or protect you.

utterance.speaker: ARMSTRONG
utterance.content: I made my feelings about him very plain. My goal was to simply stop his activities. I never intended for him to get hurt. Do you think that my um … my words and my mission could have lead Candice to do something terrible? Is that possible?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If I were in Candice’s shoes I would have done the same thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I mean, I feel for her, I do, but she knew what she was getting into.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She knew Beau would blackmail her? So this is her fault?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: With what her dad did? She must have known who Beau was and what he was about. It’s not like it was with Scarlett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, I see. So this is about you. Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey that chick totally misrepresented herself, bro. She was hot though, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here’s the sad thing for you. That fact that she misrepresented herself makes her even hotter.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. She can’t be any hotter than she already is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh. Oh, check this out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It is an email to Candice from Beau. With an attachment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Probably the terms of the blackmail. What Beau wanted in exchange for keeping the lid on that sex tape.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, no, no. This is some kind of trust set up by Beau for $5 million dollars.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well that makes no sense. If he was blackmailing her why would he be giving her money?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The trust isn’t for Candice. The beneficiary is listed as a JD Mayfield.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I didn’t find a JD Mayfield in her family.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A John Doe. Or a Jane Doe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, check this out. In Candice’s datebook there’s an ultrasound dated just a few days ago. And the patient is listed as a C. Mayfield.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Candice is pregnant. And Beau set up the trust for her baby. And why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because it’s his kid.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: I met Beau at a bar. I thought he was funny and cute. I had no idea who he was. I’m pretty sure he didn’t know who I was, either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Star-crossed lovers. It’s like Romeo and Juliet.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: If Romeo and Juliet had gotten drunk and had a meaningless one night stand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Point taken.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: When I found out I was pregnant, I knew letting him know was the right thing to do. I mean, I figured he wouldn’t care. That he would tell me I was on my own. And I would have been fine with that. But when I showed him that first ultrasound he got so choked up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was this?

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: About two months ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s when he broke it off with Tiffany. And when he got interested in Little Frog Enterprises. He was cleaning up his act. Going legit.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: Pretty much. I thought it was all an act. But he called all the time. He said he really wanted to be a part of the child’s life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you knew your father would disapprove.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: My father disapproves about most things. It was me. I was the one that didn’t want Beau around. Not with his reputation. I didn’t want that for my baby. Beau wouldn’t give up. He told me that all his life he had been searching, that he was looking for meaning in his life. And that he finally found it. It was being a father. He kept telling me that he would convince me that he could change.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did you go to the club that night?

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: Beau asked me to meet him there. He wanted to tell me that he was shutting down his business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was selling it?

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: No, he was shutting it down for girl. He said that it was the only way to convince me. So the DVDs, the website, it was all going away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he tell anyone else that he planned on shutting it down?

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: Yes, he did. That night, in fact.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Okay, all right, girls. You ready? We’re going to take a little bit of tape right up here while the crew sets up. C’mon! Up, up, up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well the show must go on, right Troy? Can’t let a little thing like the death of your boss get in the way of your party.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Look, I miss Beau. He was a good friend, but this is a business. Okay, we’ve got videos to produce, distribution deals, this doesn’t just end. Okay look, I honor his memory by keeping the party going.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that’s nice. Except if you really wanted to honor his memory you would shut down the whole operation.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Shut it down?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know that Beau told you that he was folding the company for good.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: That’s crazy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and you probably thought so too. That’s why you decided you couldn’t let it happen.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When we found out you had motive we took a look at your footage.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: Yeah, and you saw that I was filming all night. Including while Beau was being killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, your camera was filming. But you weren’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Normally the footage from a handheld camera would be in motion.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And yours was in motion. Except for from 11:50 to 11:58. About the time Beau headed to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For those eight minutes the footage was rock steady.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You put your camera on a tripod and you walked away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You left it running knowing that it would give you an alibi.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: I mean yeah, I used a tripod but that doesn’t prove I killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. But the DNA on the murder weapon will.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: DNA?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We got a court order to test it against yours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Party’s over, Troy.

utterance.speaker: TROY
utterance.content: He promised me that I would take over the business someday. Promised he’d get me rich and then he just decides to end it all? Decides to screw me over? Because of what? Some baby? C’mon! How can you give up all this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re about to find out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cuff him.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: So that’s why Beau was killed? Over money?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m afraid so. But you should know that what he told you was the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He really was trying to be a better man.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: I’m just sad that our baby will never get to meet him. But one day I’ll tell her his story. How Beau gave his life to be her father.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re having a daughter then?

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s wonderful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think your dad’s here to see you.

utterance.speaker: CANDICE
utterance.content: I guess I should tell him what’s going on. Thank you. For finding out the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think he’ll be able to accept his grandchild?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What makes you so sure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because a father would do anything for his daughter.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
